title.rendered: Columbia University Scholarships for International Students

content.rendered:
Columbia University is a school that is not owned by the government, located in the United States. It was started in 1754 and is seen as one of the older colleges in the United States. It has a long history of giving good education to students and helping professionals in the academic field find jobs.

Located in New York City, students at Columbia University can meet nice people who live there, study in a safe city, and experience an interesting culture.

International students find American universities appealing because they offer high-quality education. And since the country is famous for its advanced technology, research, and new ideas, having a degree from a US university will make your resume more appealing. It’s not surprising that the country has a lot of students from other countries.

Columbia University is a really big school with 31,500 students. It has a diverse and interesting social scene where you can meet people from different backgrounds.

Columbia University is a very prestigious university in the United States that is ranked highly by multiple ranking systems. As a student from another country, you can find really good classes in African American and African Diaspora Studies, American Studies, and Ancient Studies, among other programs for undergraduate students. For a Master’s degree, you will receive high-quality education in subjects like African-American Studies, American Studies, and Anthropology.

Columbia University offers money and other help to international students like scholarships and grants. These tools can help you achieve your goal of studying overseas without spending too much money. In this article, you will learn about the scholarships available for you to apply for at Columbia University.

Columbia University Admissions

To apply to Columbia University, make sure to complete the admission requirements and follow the application procedure. You can find more information on the following links:

  • Domestic and International Bachelor’s Admissions Page
  • Domestic and International Master’s Admissions Page

Columbia University Application Deadlines

It is essential that you meet the application deadlines at Columbia University. Here are the deadlines:

  • Bachelor’s Deadline (Early Decision ): November 1, 2023
  • Bachelor’s Deadline (Regular Decision): January 1, 2024
  • Master’s Deadline (Fall Admission): March 14, 2024 (Different Master’s programs have different deadlines)
  • Master’s Deadline (Early Admission): January 31, 2024 (Different Master’s programs have different deadlines)

Tuition Fees at Columbia University for International Students

In this section, we will be discussing the tuition fees for international students at Columbia University. The bachelor’s tuition fees for international students at Columbia University is 60,600 USD per year. Master’s tuition fee for international students at Columbia University is 52,100 USD to 77,400 USD per year.

When studying abroad, it is best to save as much money as you can. After all, there are other costs to consider besides tuition fees, such as accommodation, meals, transportation, and books.

The scholarships at Columbia University can help fund your study expenses. There are currently 5 scholarships being offered to international students at the Columbia University, all with varying requirements, benefits, and application processes. We have compiled them in this list to help you find the scholarship that best fits you.

Columbia University Scholarships for International Students

Undergraduate Scholarships

1. Need-Based Financial Aid

  • Scholarship Type: Full Funding
  • Degrees Offered : Bachelor’s

Need-Based Financial Aid is a fully funded scholarship offered to international students. This is one of the most generous scholarships at the Columbia University.

To be considered for this undergraduate scholarship at Columbia University, you must meet the following eligibility requirements:

  • international students requesting financial aid upon submitting their admission application

You can check the full list of requirements listed in the scholarship link above. You will also find the specific steps to submit your application for there.

It’s important to submit your application before the deadline indicated on the scholarship page, as this will provide the selection committee time to consider your application. Successful applicants will receive the following benefits:

  • 100% of the students’ demonstrated financial need

Graduate Scholarships

1. Graduate Assistantships

  • Scholarship Type: Full Funding
  • Degrees Offered : Master’s and PhD

Columbia University also provides financial support to international students in Master’s and PhD programs through Graduate Assistantships.

Through Graduate Assistantships, Master’s and PhD students at the Columbia University enjoy the following benefits:

  • Tuition fees
  • $1,238 per semester for course assistantships
  • $3,375 to $5,000 per semester for teaching assistantships
  • $3,375 to $9,000 or $4,500 to $9,000 (for students receiving grants) per semester for research assistantships
  • Health fees
  • Academic support fees

Graduate Assistantships is a great scholarship to apply to if you are on a tight budget.

All practical information related to preparing and submitting your application is available at the scholarship link above. Make sure to prepare and send your documents in time for the application deadline.

2. Lemann Fellowship

  • Scholarship Type: Partial Funding
  • Degrees Offered : Master’s

As an international student in a graduate program, living abroad can be quite costly if you don’t prepare for your expenses. This is why partially funded scholarships like Lemann Fellowship are available at the Columbia University for qualified students.

Lemann Fellowship is open to Master’s international students who meet the following eligibility requirements:

  • international students who intend to use their master’s degree to contribute to the development of education, teaching curricula, innovation, and technology advancement in Brazil

Columbia University awards the following scholarship benefits to successful applicants:

  • 80% of tuition and accommodation fees

Clearly, this scholarship offers very valuable benefits to deserving students.

Make sure to check out the scholarship link for the requirements you need to complete and submit before the deadline.

3. Abby O’Neill Fellowship

  • Scholarship Type: Partial Funding
  • Scholarship Amount: 48,000 USD
  • Degrees Offered : Master’s

Abby O’Neill Fellowship is a partially funded scholarship offered to Master’s students at Columbia University. Students need to meet the following requirements to be eligible:

  • incoming students enrolling in an elementary or secondary teacher master’s degree at the University of Columbia

Successful applicants are granted the following benefits:

  • a $48,000 tuition fee deduction

There are other fees to pay for, but getting this scholarship will still help you financially as an international student at Columbia University.

4. GSAAP Admission Scholarship

  • Scholarship Type: Partial Funding
  • Degrees Offered : Master’s

Columbia University also provides financial support to international students in Master’s programs through GSAAP Admission Scholarship. Interested applicants for this partially funded scholarship must meet the following certain eligibility requirements to be considered:

  • Enrolling full-time
  • Students demonstrating outstanding academic performance

Through GSAAP Admission Scholarship, Master’s students at the Columbia University enjoy the following benefits:

  • a certain amount determined by the Program’s Admissions Committee paid out each term in form of a tuition award

You will still need to shoulder some costs, but getting a GSAAP Admission Scholarship grant will help you fund your studies significantly.

All practical information related to preparing and submitting your application is available at the scholarship link above. Make sure to prepare and send your documents in time for the application deadline.

With these Columbia University scholarships for international students, you can finally study abroad financially worry-free. If you’re interested, make sure to also check out the Open Courses for International Students.
